alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 1:04PM PST until January 06 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches with locally higher amounts over the peaks. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada Counties including Interstate 80 over Donner Pass, Highway 50 over Echo Summit and Highway 88 over Carson Pass. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible with travel delays, chain controls, snow covered roads and poor visibility with near white out conditions at times. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels around 2,000 to 3,000 feet. Snowfall rates of 2 inches per hour are possible. Elevations below 2,000 feet should see little or no accumulation. The hazardous conditions will impact travel through tonight.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for California can be obtained by calling 800-427-7623 (ROAD) or visit quickmap.dot.ca.gov for the latest road conditions before traveling.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
